Reviews.Content: Hotel photos a misrep The hotel has its own covered carpark which is a relief since there was simply nowhere to park nearby. I would recommend taking the no.22 bus to the city centre (or if it's in the evening, take a taxi, it's only 10-15 euros and we felt much safer) rather than driving as you wouldn't have to worry about finding a parking space. Bus tickets can be purchased from the hotel reception- you need a ticket before boarding the bus. Staff are very friendly.I must say though that the photos you see of the rooms of this hotel are very misleading, and based solely on the pictures posted up I was very unimpressed when I actually walked into the room. But then the room was very spacious and quite clean, and the kitchen was fully functionable. There's a supermarket next to the reception so you can get all your cooking supplies there. Via di Novoli is a big road so don't be surprised if you are woken up by traffic in the morning.They say you have internet access in the room, but that is only if you brought your own laptop- you can borrow a cable from them. Wi-Fi doesn't work in the room.Just don't expect grandeur- at this rate you're getting value for money.
Reviews.Author: JC_sakura

Reviews.Content: Great Rooms       The bed was comfy enough... no real complaints.
Reviews.Author: jljahrig

Reviews.Content: Great facilities for a great price A fantastic place to stay if you don't mind being a 15 minute bus ride from the centre. We had a 1 bedroom apartment with a kingsize bed in the bedroom and the largest sofa bed I've ever seen in the living room. The kitchen was fantastically equiped with a dishwasher (and dishwasher tablets). But, the local restaurant which the reception recommended to us was so good that we didn't use the kitchen! Really great value with very helpful staff.Recommended!
Reviews.Author: Lobe

Reviews.Content: good apartment hotel Stayed there for 2 nights. Good apartment hotel, looks brand new , rooms are very big with a nice shower and an excellent kitchen.Has a privte parking for an additional 10 euros and very welcoming staff.No breakfast but there are several restaurants and a supermarket nearby.Located outside of the center of florence but there's a bus station to take you there just outside the hotel.The only thing which damped our stay was that the rooms werent clean enough.
Reviews.Author: asaf78

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel The first thing to say is we stayed in the main building on Via di Novoli, there is now a newer building around the back which is where reception is located, on arrival at the hotel on Via di Novoli you find a poster on the door asking you to walk around the block to the new reception, it鈥檚 not a problem and there is an intercom to the new building.The hotel is in a residential stay or self catering style with all cooking facilities provided, these are quite neatly hidden behind folding doors so if you did want to do your own cooking you will find you have everything you need (even a dishwasher). It would have been nice to have a kettle but a pan served well on the electric hob.Getting to the hotel: There are a few things here that might help as the directions are not too good if you鈥檙e using public transport. Take the number 22 bus from the station, the bus trip is about 10-15 minutes, the hotel is on the left hand side of the road and not easy to spot, the easiest method is to keep a look-out on the right for a big Euronics store, press the stop bell when you see it and the next stop will be the one you want with the hotel on your left. We were looking for the building numbers on the right (you can't see the left, it鈥檚 too far), the problem we had was that by the time you have reached just No60 on the right you have missed the hotel (No87 on the left) as the numbers increase quicker on the right.One very good thing is free internet (wired not Wi-Fi) in your room, reception will give you a cable, login  password if you ask.The room was very clean and bed was very comfortable, being a city location the views were nothing to write home about. You also have a nice large balcony.We walked to the train station on one day (May 1st as its a public holiday and no busses were running) and it takes about 30 minutes but is an easy direct walk without needing to change direction. we stayed on the top floor (5th) and did not hear any noise from the next door rooms and although a little street noise which is to be expected it was a nice quiet room.Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: Ziggyuk

Reviews.Content: Excellent apartment for a very good price We stayed at the Quadra Key apartment for two nights in mid-April 2008 and found it to be excellent accommodation 鈥?particularly for the discounted price of EURO150 that we got through Wotif. After staying in plenty of 'character' accommodation in Italy, we were pleased to get something that was near new, very clean (we didn't realised it was serviced so returned one day to find the place completely cleaned for us) and with comfortable beds. Even better, it had WiFi web access so we could catch up on emails and skype home. Yes, it is a little out of the centre of town, but the 22 bus goes from just outside right to the Duomo, and the car parking bay is much appreciated if you are doing day trips. The local Hertz office is also only a 100 m walk away. There is a supermarket downstairs (a small one, although a bigger store is about 500m away) plus a laundromat around the corner. We were very happy with the two-bedroom apartment we received and equally happy with the service. A real find. One note, no kettle or toaster: don't know why, but this seems to be fairly common in Italian accommodation. We learnt to use a pot on the stove and the grill.
Reviews.Author: Taragon

Reviews.Content: 2 nights in Florence We depended on our GPS completely to drive around Italy, and had some difficulty finding this hotel in a congested neighborhood of a congested city. The reception office is located in a different building and street than our room, and there is no sign to indicate we'd finally found it. Parking is very secure with a key for the basement garage, as well as a key for the main door of the building and one for the apartment dead bolt lock. The neighborhood didn't feel safe at night, and street noise was loud. That said, the room itself was nice: clean and modern. We didn't use the kitchen except for the refrigerator. We would've liked a microwave instead of a dishwasher! The bathroom was very small, but all new and nicely decorated. It lacked a hairdryer. The beds were comfortable, and as we travel with earplugs we slept well. Highly recommend the cafe/patisserie across the street for breakfast. Excellent coffee and delicious pastries. The bus line runs right by the building, and the staff of the hotel was helpful with bus tickets and map.
Reviews.Author: TxBeech

Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. Highly recommended. My boyfriend and I booked this hotel at the last minute and got a fantasic deal online.Ok so its not in the centre, but the bus went into town was reliable frequent and quick, and went from right outside the apartments. It was actually a bit of a relief to come back there to eascape all the hussle of the centre of town. Theres a good patisserie just opposite for grabbing a coffee and croissant in the mornings.The rooms are modern, spacious and clean and the check in staff helpful and efficient. Also there's a supermarket within walking distance so you can easily use the well equipped kitchen. I'd definitely stay again, but realise if its baroque romance and elegance you're after- this probably wont be for you...
Reviews.Author: GPHerts

Reviews.Content: Florence The Quadra key was a very modern and clean hotel/apartment. In general you could not fault it, The no. 22 bus could be got outside the hotel straight into the centre of florence.
Reviews.Author: vocjewl

Reviews.Content: Great stay Had a great stay a Quadra Keys. Staff is very helpful. Location is outside of the tourist area but the bus #22 stops right in front of the hotel and it is only 10 minutes to downtown. A large grocery store is 200 meters away as is a hertz office and an atm is next door. I stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment, it had a fully furnished kitchen, large bathroom , and was clean. It also had a 25 foot balcony that had a wash tub and drying rack. This helped out on washing and drying my clothes for our long trip. I would highly recomend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: eazyeee

Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, great food! I stayed as a single traveller in this apartment complex. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the staff all extremely knowledgable about the local area, and bus routes into town. It is true that it faces on to a busy road, however, I did not mark this down as other delegates at the conference I was attending seemed to have the problem at other accommodations, so I feel that this is rather more a global issue for Florence. The ASDL line is relatively slow, but for a quick check of email is ok.I think that the advantage of staying here is the close proximity to the supermarket, and thus the ability to cook wonderfully fresh, delicious ingredients. Staying at a hotel would have meant me missing what felt like the best part of the trip (the food).I would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: catninja

Reviews.Content: Great value for Florence Our family of four stayed in the apartments for three nights very recently..it was to be initially 2 nights but we were so happy with the accommodation and facilities that we extended for a further night. The apartments are spacious with a great little kitchen complete with oven, cooktop, dishwasher and full fridge (far superior to the facilities at our Tuscan villa). The staff were fantastic, very helpful on all levels and nothing was too much trouble from travel arrangements to restaurant recommendations . They were kind enough to open their reception earlier than usual to cater for our early departure and even offered us a coffee to start our day. We travelled by taxi to the city centre each day at a cost of around ten euros which represents fantastic value for the ease and convenience. At the end of the day (and it was hot) we easily hailed a cab and in ten minutes we were back in our air conditioned haven. The main road was hectic but we were not disturbed by any noise at night. Highly recommended, particularly for families and those seeking some opportunity for self catering .
Reviews.Author: FamilyfunBrisbane

Reviews.Content: spacious and modern We stayed at the quadra keys for one night only and booked it as it had free adsl (which is very slow) and free parking which is a bonus for florence as there is very little...and what there is can be expensive.Anyway...the hotel....It is very modern and spacious and the parking is secure. The walls are a little on the thin side but all mod buildings in italy seem to be that way, and it was not really a bother.It has sat LCD tv which is cool and a full kitchen (no washing facilities though which an apartment hotel really should have).There is a bus right outside that takes you into the centre of florence in about ten minutes for 1.2 euros...very easy.. but you do have to spend all day in town with no break in the middle of the day for your feet. It is a very comfotable experience though. Booked it on wotif and paid a lot less than regular price. Would i stay again? If i had a car and was here for only a very short time yes...but otherwise better to stay in something shabbier and be right in town.
Reviews.Author: baser

Reviews.Content: Lovely room but... We stayed at the Quadra Keys in May. The rooms are large and spacious. The addition of a kitchenette within the room is great and has been tastefully done. The bathroom was fine. The only criticism was the noise from the main road outside. It was constant and it often woke us at night. The staff are great and very helpful. The hotel itself is about 10 minutes by bus from the centre of town. The bus stop is directly outside the apartments and tickets can be obtained from the reception desk. I would recommend it but the owners may have to do something to the apartments to quieten the noise down.
Reviews.Author: LondonHotspots
